Class LineTracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • LineTracker

  • public class LineTracker
extends java.lang.Object
    this class runs the line tracking is a child to the grid navigation. It follows lines and alerts the higher up controls of obstacles.
    Author:
    peter

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static lejos.hardware.Audio audio 
      static lejos.hardware.Keys keys 
      static lejos.hardware.lcd.TextLCD lcd 
      static int moveSpeed
      general speed of motions.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void calibrate()
      instructs thr robot to calibrate the left and right sensors by calling the calibrate method of the MyPilot class given the left and right sensor objects
      void driveOverCross()
      instructs the robot to drive until neither sensor is on the line, which results in the robot driving forward off the cross
      boolean investigatePath()
      instructs the robot to follow the line it's on until it reaches a 'cross', or finds an obstacle in it's way.
      boolean reverseInvestigatePath()
      instructs the robot to follow the line in reverse it's on until it reaches a 'cross'
      void turnLeft()
      turn left
      void turnRight()
      turn right

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • moveSpeed

        public static final int moveSpeed
        general speed of motions. This controls line tracking speed, turn speed, and scan speed. it is currently 40% of max power.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static final lejos.hardware.lcd.TextLCD lcd

    • Method Detail

      • investigatePath

        public boolean investigatePath()
        instructs the robot to follow the line it's on until it reaches a 'cross', or finds an obstacle in it's way.

      • reverseInvestigatePath

        public boolean reverseInvestigatePath()
        instructs the robot to follow the line in reverse it's on until it reaches a 'cross'

      • driveOverCross

        public void driveOverCross()
        instructs the robot to drive until neither sensor is on the line, which results in the robot driving forward off the cross

      • calibrate

        public void calibrate()
        instructs thr robot to calibrate the left and right sensors by calling the calibrate method of the MyPilot class given the left and right sensor objects
